goal.ch: Organizational design is a primary management tool for organizing business processes and developing organizational competencies and capabilities for competing in today’s dynamic environment. In this course, we emphasize the idea that a key goal of organizational design is effective creation and use of knowledge. A firm can design structure to optimize at a point in time or to innovate and adopt. Students are expected to apply the principles of organizational design learned in this course to manage human resources and organizational change in response to changing environments.
